Mission Planner and ArduPilot

Back to main menue.

ArduPilot is an open source suite and platform of Hardware, Firmware, Software and Community of users and developers providing autonomous multicopters, fixed-wing aircraft, traditional helicopters and ground rovers drones able to perform UAV / unmanned vehicle missions.

Mission Planner is a full-featured ground station application for the ArduPilot open source autopilot project. Some interesting web links to ArduPilot platform;

  • History of ArduPilot
  • DIYDRONES

Installation

Following these instructions, we can install Mission Planner on debian derived linux OS. We need to perform the following:

  1. Install Mono
  2. Set user rights
  3. Download and unzip Mission Planner
  4. Running Mission Planner over Mono
We have unzipped MissionPlanner in ~/software 
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 \\
--recv-keys 3FA7E0328081BFF6A14DA29AA6A19B38D3D831EF
 
echo "deb http://download.mono-project.com/repo/debian wheezy main" | sudo \\
tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mono-xamarin.list
 
sudo apt-get update
 
sudo apt-get install mono-runtime libmono-system-windows-forms4.0-cil \\
libmono-system-xml-linq4.0-cil libmono-system-management4.0-cil \\
libmono-system-web4.0-cil libmono-corlib4.5-cil \\
libmono-system-numerics4.0-cil festival
 
sudo apt-get install mono-complete festival
 
echo $USER
 
sudo adduser $USER dialout
 
cd software/missionplanner/
 
mono MissionPlanner.exe

Usage

We use mission planner to communicate between the laptop and the Pixhawk autopilot and specifically to:

  1. Update parameter settings of the Iris+
  2. Check the correct compilation of parameter settings. Even if you use 3DR Tower flight control software is good to double check parameters at least onece with MissionPlanner.
  3. Upload missions from laptop to pixhawk.
  4. Download log files of missions from Pixhawk to laptop once the drone has landed.
Log files include all flight parameters recorded during the flight (speed, direction, gps coordinates, altiyude etc. ) and used successively for post flight data processing and mapping.

We can use Mission Planner to program a survey mission for mapping follow this video to quick learn how to do.

We have now switched to to 3DR Tower software which is available for Android/linux platforms and is handy to use in the field with a tablet.
